docs.snippet: INTERESTING FROM ALBANY. Greens Muster of the Democracy-Morning of the servo commerce-Movements of the leasors-wetting of the Aslor Committee-Preposition for conetitation,  AIBANY, Tuesday, Aug, 2. There is considerable excitement about the principal...
docs.lead_paragraph: INTERESTING FROM ALBANY. Greens Muster of the Democracy-Morning of the servo commerce-Movements of the leasors-wetting of the Aslor Committee-Preposition for conetitation, AIBANY, Tuesday, Aug, 2. There is considerable excitement about the principal hotel here to -night the Democrate, who have mustoyed in great force.

docs.snippet: The recent act of the Commissioners of Emigration, summarily cutting off the pay and rations of the assistants of Dr. JEROME, the physician of the Marine Hospital, produces no marked effect among the few persons remaining upon the Quarantine grounds....

headline.main: Matters at Quarantine.; THE DISMISSED EMPLOYES OF DR. JEROME--WHO HAS CHARGE OF THE FALCON, AND WHO PAYS THE BILLS--THE SECOND FLOATING HOSPITAL DESCRIBED.

docs.lead_paragraph: The recent act of the Commissioners of Emigration, summarily cutting off the pay and rations of the assistants of Dr. JEROME, the physician of the Marine Hospital, produces no marked effect among the few persons remaining upon the Quarantine grounds. Still confident that their services will sooner or later come into play, they are waiting quietly an order to resume.

docs.snippet: Affairs in Washington. WASHINGTON, Monday, Aug, 1. Col. SIM. JOHNSON, one of the editors of the late Washington Union, who several months ago was appointed Consul to Havre, has tendered his resignation. The office, however, is not open for...
docs.lead_paragraph: Affairs in Washington. WASHINGTON, Monday, Aug, 1. Col. SIM. JOHNSON, one of the editors of the late Washington Union, who several months ago was appointed Consul to Havre, has tendered his resignation. The office, however, is not open for competition.

docs.snippet: PRERSENTATION OF COLORS TO THE TURNERS.--There was a general turn out of the New-York German Turnverein yesterday, and a festival at Launman's Park, on which occasion some five or six thousand people assembled to witness the presentation of a...
docs.lead_paragraph: PRERSENTATION OF COLORS TO THE TURNERS.--There was a general turn out of the New-York German Turnverein yesterday, and a festival at Launman's Park, on which occasion some five or six thousand people assembled to witness the presentation of a handsome Banner to the Turner's Society.

docs.snippet: THE HEALTH OF THE CITY.--Green fields and meandering streams, the fresh breezes of the bills, and the temptations of "yellow sands" are at any time sufficient to draw out of the City the denizens of crowded streets who have a love for nature; but...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE HEALTH OF THE CITY.--Green fields and meandering streams, the fresh breezes of the bills, and the temptations of "yellow sands" are at any time sufficient to draw out of the City the denizens of crowded streets who have a love for nature; but there are hosts of our City people now wandering idly about the country, and crowding the hotels at the watering places,

docs.snippet: By the packet bark N. H. Gaston, at NewHaven, we have advices from Barbados to the 12th of July. No political news is reported. Ten American vessels were in port when the Gaston sailed. They hoisted their colors on the national anniversary. The day...
docs.lead_paragraph: By the packet bark N. H. Gaston, at NewHaven, we have advices from Barbados to the 12th of July. No political news is reported. Ten American vessels were in port when the Gaston sailed. They hoisted their colors on the national anniversary. The day was not otherwise observed.

docs.snippet: The Steamship Northera Light, Capt. TINELXPATION, from Asplnwall, July 23, arrived here yesterday morning. Among the passengers are Gen. MIBALEAU LAMAB U. S. Minister to Central America, (whose arrived by the Moscs Taylor was erroneously reported.)...

headline.main: THE PACIFIC COAST.; Rush of the Population for the Indian Burial Places. TWO WEEKS LATER FROM SOUTH AMERICA. IDOL-WORSHIP REVIVED. HTE CHIRIQUI GOLD FEVER. ARRIVAL OF THE NORTHERN LIGHT. Four Days Later from the Isthmus.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Steamship Northera Light, Capt. TINELXPATION, from Asplnwall, July 23, arrived here yesterday morning. Among the passengers are Gen. MIBALEAU LAMAB U. S. Minister to Central America, (whose arrived by the Moscs Taylor was erroneously reported.) Mr WELLs, has secretary Ge. MANUAL M. MALLANINO, Ex President of New Grenada: JOHN S. STAVENSON, Esq., Bearer of Dispatches from Chilll and CHABLES S. E. JONES, Esq., Bearer of Dispatches from Hogota.

docs.snippet: MOETALIY,--Health Officer BOYD reports 141 deaths for the week ending saturday last, classified as follows: Men 20, women 1, boys 55, girls 56; adults 30, chidren 111, roals 75, females 66.
docs.lead_paragraph: MOETALIY,--Health Officer BOYD reports 141 deaths for the week ending saturday last, classified as follows: Men 20, women 1, boys 55, girls 56; adults 30, chidren 111, roals 75, females 66.
